thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn now favourite to be the next Prime Minister after night of General Election shocks

author: Mike Kelly
title: Jeremy Corbyn now favourite to be the next Prime Minister after night of General Election shocks
text:
News Jeremy Corbyn now favourite to be the next Prime Minister after night of General Election shocks In a night of surprises, Paddy Power makes Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn odds on to be the next PM, ahead of Theresa May Share     Thank you for subscribing!   
Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn is now favourite to be the next Prime Minister, ahead of Theresa May. 
In a 2017 General Election night of shocks starting with the exit poll, Mr Corbyn getting the keys to Number 10 is perhaps the biggest. 
Paddy Power puts him at 10/11 to be the next PM with Mrs May at evens and Boris Johnson at 8/1. Labour party leader Jeremy Corbyn (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
This is despite the exit poll predicting that the Conservatives would be the largest party following the vote. 
However, the future of Ms May is already shrouded in doubt as it was her decision to call a snap election to get a strong mandate for Brexit negotiations which are due to start in around 10 days. 
She was hoping for a crushing victory and, even if the exit poll is slightly wrong, that is not going to happen. Read More Odds on next Conservative leader as calls are made for Theresa May to resign 
A Coalition between the Conservatives under Mrs May and any other party is highly unlikely now. 
While it has the traditional support of around 10 unionist MPs in Northern Ireland, no other party is a natural fit. 
However Mr Corbyn could head a Coalition of parties as there is more common ground to be found. Read More 
It’s an astonishing thought that in a few days time Mr Corbyn could waiting for a congratulatory call from US President Donald Trump. 
Who wouldn’t want to eavesdrop on that conversation? Read More
